content.div:
Despite Chris Brown’s disturbing behaviour (see: everything he’s said or done this week), the one person who has the most reason to hate him continues to be the one person who seems the most willing to forgive his woman-beating, chair-throwing past: Rihanna.

Reports continue to circulate that the Barbados-born beauty invited Brown to her pre-birthday bash on Valentine’s Day, with TMZ claiming he asked his entourage to try to force everyone in the club to sign confidentiality agreements before he entered. Despite failing to secure every guest's signature, Brown reportedly attended the bash anyway and was spotted "nuzzling" up against his former ex.

While anti-Team Breezy sentiment continues to flood Twitter, new reports have surfaced that Brown and Rihanna are collaborating in the studio. Rumours of the musical mashup began circulating last week when producing team Da Internz told MTV News the guest vocalist on Rihanna's upcoming remix of "Birthday Cake" would "shock the world."

Now, Miss Info is reporting that the special guest star is indeed Brown. According to the site, he recorded a signing verse and a rap verse for "Birthday Cake."

Until Rihanna’s camp confirms the collab, we’re still holding out hope that the guest star turns out to be her buddy Drake (Wheel Chair Jimmy would never do anything to hurt RiRi!), or Christina Aguilera, which would explain Rihanna’s recent Tweet: "I need somebody #DIRRRTY on my Birthday #CAKE."

Meanwhile, at least one disturbing report about Brown’s behavior has been shot down. Yesterday, an employee at a Grammy gifting suite told Us Weekly that Brown tried to pick her up with the line, "Can I get your number? I promise I won't beat you!"

Though his rep offered the mag a weak denial ("I'd be surprised if Chris said something that stupid"), Brown himself has denounced the report, telling TMZ, "That is absurd and absolutely not true. I did not say that nor would I joke about that."
